analyzed: 'dir ni ji star chos mthun pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: srog chags seng ge ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags thams cad kyi nang na @42a * //

analyzed: rtsa la che ba dang / gzengs mtho ba dang / brtan pas pha rol gnon pa yin pas /

analyzed: yi dags kyi nyal stangs dang / lha'i nyal stangs dang / 'dod pa la longs spyod pa dag gi nyal stangs ni de lta ma yin gyi /
translated: The sleeping postures of hungry ghosts, gods, and those who enjoy desires are not like that.

analyzed: 'di ltar de dag thams cad ni le lo can dang / brtson 'grus zhan pa ;

analyzed: stobs dang / pha rol gnon pa chung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gcig tu na glo g-yas pas seng ge bzhin du nyal ba gang yin pa de ni chos nyid kyis 'di ltar lus dag lhod par mi 'gyur zhing gnyid log nas yang dran pa brjed par mi 'gyur ba dang / gnyid stug por mi 'gyur ba dang ;

analyzed: rmi lam na sdig pa rmi bar mi 'gyur ba yin gyi /

analyzed: de lta ma yin par nyal na ni de las bzlog pa'i nyes pa thams cad 'byung bar rig par bya ste /

original: legs par bsten /
analyzed: legs par bsten /

analyzed: legs par so sor brtags te /

analyzed: des na de gnyid log na yang sems la mun pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: de ltar na snang pa'i 'du shes kyis nyal bar byed pa yin no //

analyzed: ji ltar na dran pas nyal bar byed pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: @42b lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dran pa de bzhin du nyal bar byed pa yin te /

analyzed: de ltar na dran pas nyal bar byed pa yin no //

original: ji ltar na shes bzhin gyis nyal bar byed pa yin zhe na /

original: de ltar na dran par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na dran par gyur pa ste /

original: gang gi tshe nyal ba na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyal ba na /

analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas sems kun nas nyon mongs par gyur na /

analyzed: des kun nas nyon mongs pa skyes pa de nyid legs pa kho nar rab tu shes shing /

analyzed: da dung mi len pa stong par byed /

original: rtog par byed /

analyzed: myur ba myur ba thums phras kyis nyal bar byed de /

analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na dgon pa'i ri dags bzhin du rnam pa thams cad kyis thams cad du gnyid kyis non pa la sems gzhol bar mi byed cing /

original: de la 'bab par mi byed /
analyzed: de la 'bab par mi byed /

analyzed: bab par mi byed pa dang / gzhan yang de 'di snyam du sems te /

analyzed: ae ma ho kye ma bdag gis sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba'i mi nyal ba rnam pa thams cad kyis thams cad du bsgrub par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: ‚ÄúOh! I will practice the Buddha‚Äôs permission to be sleepless in every way and at all times.‚Äù

analyzed: des de bsgrub pa'i phyir shin tu 'bad pa chen po dang / mngon par brtson pa'i sbyor bas mthun pa skyed de /

analyzed: gnas par byed pa dang / gzhan yang de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks, ‚ÄúI will practice in this way:

analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis ded mi nyal ba dang dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa'i phyir /
translated: I will not sleep and I will cultivate virtuous qualities.

original: mkhas shing le lo med la /
analyzed: mkhas shing le lo med la /
translated: I will be skilled, not lazy,

original: sgrub phod pas brtson 'grus brtsams te /
analyzed: sgrub phod pas brtson 'grus brtsams te /

original: gnas bzhin du sang nam langs pa'i nang par yang sgrub phod pas /
analyzed: gnas bzhin du sang nam langs pa'i nang par yang sgrub phod pas /
translated: I will practice in this way until tomorrow morning when the sun comes up.

original: rgya cher brtson 'grus brtsams te gnas par bya'o snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: rgya cher brtson 'grus brtsams te gnas par bya'o snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: I will practice with great perseverance.‚Äù

original: de la ldang ba'i 'du shes gcig gis ni gnyid sdug por mi byed de /
analyzed: de la ldang ba'i 'du shes gcig gis ni gnyid sdug por mi byed de /

analyzed: des ni de ldang ba'i dus su myur ba myur ba kho nar ldang zhing dus las mi yol bar sad par nus so //

original: pa rgyun mi chad par byed do //
analyzed: pa rgyun mi chad par byed do //

analyzed: de ltar na ldang ba kho na'i 'du shes yid la byed bzhin du nyal bar byed pa yin no //

original: de mtshan mo'i thun tha ma la yang myur ba myur ba kho nar sad par byas nas /
analyzed: de mtshan mo'i thun tha ma la yang myur ba myur ba kho nar sad par byas nas /

original: 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las /
analyzed: 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las /

original: sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa yin te zhes bya ba la /

original: mtshan mo'i thun tha ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan mo'i thun tha ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The last part of the night is the last part of the night.üîΩ

original: nam gyi tho rangs kyi cha las me la tshe thun gcig lhag tsam gang yin pa'o//
analyzed: nam gyi tho rangs kyi cha las me la tshe thun gcig lhag tsam gang yin pa'o//
translated: The last watch of the night is the time remaining after one watch at the end of the night.

original: de yang snang ba'i 'du shes dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa kho na'i 'du shes yid la byed bzhin du mtshan mo'i gung tshigs kyi thun la mel tshe thun gcig lhag tsam gnyid bsad par byas nas gang gi tshe ldang ba de'i rmugs pa dangüîΩgnyid kyi kun nas bkris pa chen pos zil gyis non cing /
analyzed: de yang snang ba'i 'du shes dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa kho na'i 'du shes yid la byed bzhin du mtshan mo'i gung tshigs kyi thun la mel tshe thun gcig lhag tsam gnyid bsad par byas nas gang gi tshe ldang ba de'i rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi kun nas bkris pa chen pos zil gyis non cing /
translated: One should sleep during the middle watch of the night, having a clear idea of the time and being mindful, self-possessed, and fully aware.

original: des ldang ba na bul ba nyid dam /
analyzed: des ldang ba na bul ba nyid dam /
translated: When one gets up, one should not be overcome by the heaviness of sleep and drowsiness.

original: zhen pa nyid dang / le lo dang snyom par 'gyur ba med cing ldang ba la lus las su rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhen pa nyid dang / le lo dang snyom par 'gyur ba med cing ldang ba la lus las su rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should not be slow, sluggish, lazy, or indolent in getting up.üîΩOne should be physically fit for getting up.

analyzed: bul ba nyid dang / zhan pa nyid dang / le lo dang / snyom pa de dag med na brtsal ba tsam nyid kyis myur ba myur ba kho nar ldang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is not slow, sluggish, lazy, or indolent, one will get up quickly, just by making an effort.

original: 'chag pa dang 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa yin te zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chag pa dang 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa yin te zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: He purifies his mind of those things that are obstacles to walking and sitting.

original: de ni re zhig nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa de nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba rgyas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa de nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba rgyas pa yin no //
translated: This is the detailed explanation of the division of the practice of not lying down in the first and last periods of the night.

original: don mdor bsdu ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: don mdor bsdu ba gang zhe na /

analyzed: de ltar na rjes su snying brtse ba dang ldan pa yin no //

analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa'i rjes su 'jug par byed la /

original: rnam par 'gyur ba med cing /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba med cing /
translated: They are not affected by being praised.üîΩThey think only of benefiting others.

original: phan pa 'ba' zhig tu sems pa dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu mchu rings pa dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sdig sbrul gyi reg pa rnams dang /

analyzed: skyes ba rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde zhes gang gsungs pa de ni mdo sde yin no // gleng gzhi'i sde zhes gang gsungs pa de ni 'dul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The upade≈õa is the teaching of the meaning in the form of an instruction.üîΩThe vinaya is the teaching of the meaning in the form of a basis.

original: gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde @57a * //
analyzed: gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde @57a * //
translated: The abhidharma is the teaching of the meaning in the form of a definitive teaching.üîΩThe twelve branches of the scriptures taught by the Bhagavat himself are called the Dharma of the scriptures.üîΩThe Dharma of realization is the realization of the meaning of the scriptures by the noble ones.üîΩThe Dharma of the scriptures is the twelve branches of the scriptures taught by the Bhagavat himself.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa de ni chos mngon pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa de ni chos mngon pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The Dharma of realization is the realization of the meaning of the scriptures by the noble ones.üîΩThe Dharma of the scriptures is the twelve branches of the scriptures taught by the Bhagavat himself.üîΩThe Dharma of realization is the realization of the meaning of the scriptures by the noble ones.üîΩThe Dharma of the scriptures is the twelve branches of the scriptures taught by the Bhagavat himself.üîΩThe Dharma of realization is the realization of the meaning of the scriptures by the noble ones.üîΩThe Dharma of the scriptures is the twelve branches of the scriptures taught by the Bhagavat himself.üîΩThe Dharma of realization is the realization of the meaning of the scriptures by the noble ones.

original: dam pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams kyis bstan pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis sde snod gsum gyis bsdus pa de dag ni dam pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams kyis bstan pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis sde snod gsum gyis bsdus pa de dag ni dam pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: The Dharma of the scriptures is the twelve branches of the scriptures taught by the Bhagavat himself.üîΩThe Dharma of realization is the realization

original: de nyan pa ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa ste /
analyzed: de nyan pa ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa ste /
translated: Listening to it is listening to the holy Dharma.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la mdo sde 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la mdo sde 'dzin pa'am /
translated: Here someone holds the sutras,

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa'am /
translated: holds the Vinaya,

original: ma mo 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: ma mo 'dzin pa'am /
translated: holds the mother texts,

original: mdo sde dang 'dul ba 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: mdo sde dang 'dul ba 'dzin pa'am /
translated: holds the sutras and the Vinaya,

original: mdo sde dang ma mo 'dzin pa'am /üîΩ'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: mdo sde dang ma mo 'dzin pa'am / 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa'am /
translated: holds the sutras and the mother texts,üîΩholds the Vinaya and the mother texts,

original: mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: or holds the sutras, the Vinaya, and the mother texts.

original: de ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called listening to the holy Dharma.

original: nyan pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyan pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Listening is of two kinds:

original: tshig 'bru nyan pa dang / don nyan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru nyan pa dang / don nyan pa'o //
translated: listening to the words and listening to the meaning.

original: sems pa gang zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar 'di na la la gcig pu dben par song ste /
analyzed: sems pa gang zhe na / 'di ltar 'di na la la gcig pu dben par song ste /
translated: What is reflection?

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas drug po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas drug po 'di lta ste /
translated: Here someone goes off alone to a secluded place and reflects on the six inconceivable topics, namely:

original: bdag la sems pa dang / sems can la sems pa dang / 'jig rten pa la sems pa dang / sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa la sems pa dang / bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi yul dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul rnam par sbyangs nas /
analyzed: bdag la sems pa dang / sems can la sems pa dang / 'jig rten pa la sems pa dang / sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa la sems pa dang / bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi yul dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul rnam par sbyangs nas /
translated: He reflects on the self, on sentient beings, on the world, on the ripening of the karma of sentient beings, on the objects of concentration of the contemplatives, and on the objects of the Buddhas.

original: ji ltar thos pa'i chos de dag nyid rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas sems par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa'i chos de dag nyid rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas sems par byed pa yin no //
translated: He reflects on those very teachings that he has heard, by way of their specific and general characteristics.

original: sems pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That reflection is of two kinds:

original: bgrang ba'i rnam pas chos rnams la bgrang ba'i tshul gyis sems par byed pa dang / gzhal ba'i rnam pas rig pas yon tan dang skyon nye bar brtag pa'i tshul gyis sems par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bgrang ba'i rnam pas chos rnams la bgrang ba'i tshul gyis sems par byed pa dang / gzhal ba'i rnam pas rig pas yon tan dang skyon nye bar brtag pa'i tshul gyis sems par byed pa yin no //
translated: He reflects on phenomena by way of enumeration, by way of the method of enumeration, and by way of evaluation, by way of the method of evaluation through knowledge of their good qualities and faults.

original: gal te phung po dang ldan pa bstan pa la sems par byed dam /
analyzed: gal te phung po dang ldan pa bstan pa la sems par byed dam /
translated: If he reflects on the teaching of the aggregates,

original: gal te de las gzhan pa sngar bstan pa gang yang rung ba bstan pa la sems par byed na yang rnam pa de gnyis kyis sems par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te de las gzhan pa sngar bstan pa gang yang rung ba bstan pa la sems par byed na yang rnam pa de gnyis kyis sems par byed pa yin te /
translated: If one contemplates any of the other topics taught above, one contemplates them in these two ways.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni skye mched gzugs can bcu dang / chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni skye mched gzugs can bcu dang / chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs gang yin pa ste /
translated: Form is the ten physical bases and the form included in the phenomena base.

original: de ni gzugs kyi phung po yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzugs kyi phung po yin no //
translated: That is the form aggregate.

original: tshor ba rnam pa gsum ni tshor ba'i phung po yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba rnam pa gsum ni tshor ba'i phung po yin no //
translated: The three kinds of feeling are the feeling aggregate.

original: 'du shes kyi tshogs drug ni 'du shes kyi phung po yin /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi tshogs drug ni 'du shes kyi phung po yin /
translated: The six collections of perception are the perception aggregate.

original: 'du byed kyi tshogs drug ni 'du byed kyi phung po yin /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi tshogs drug ni 'du byed kyi phung po yin /
translated: The six collections of formation are the formation aggregate.

original: rnam @57b par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po yin te /
analyzed: rnam @57b par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po yin te /
translated: The six collections of consciousness are the consciousness aggregate.

original: de ltar na bgrang ba dang / grangs kyi rnam par phung po bstan pa la sems par byed pa dang / gong nas gong du rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyis grangs dang / bgrang ba'i rnam pa sems pa de la tshad med pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i tshul du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na bgrang ba dang / grangs kyi rnam par phung po bstan pa la sems par byed pa dang / gong nas gong du rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyis grangs dang / bgrang ba'i rnam pa sems pa de la tshad med pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i tshul du rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that the teaching of the aggregates is contemplated by means of counting and enumeration, and that the counting and enumeration is contemplated by means of the method of ever increasing divisions, and that this is done by means of the immeasurability of the aggregates.

original: ji ltar na rigs pas nye bar brtags pa'i sems pas phung po bstan pa la sems par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rigs pas nye bar brtags pa'i sems pas phung po bstan pa la sems par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one contemplate the teaching of the aggregates by means of the mind that investigates with reasoning?

original: rigs pa bzhis nye bar rtog par byed de /
analyzed: rigs pa bzhis nye bar rtog par byed de /
translated: One investigates with four reasonings.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pas so //
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pas so //
translated: the reasoning of dependence, the reasoning of function, the reasoning of proof by evidence, and the reasoning of reality.

original: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reasoning of dependence?

original: ltos pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ltos pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of dependence:

original: skye ba'i ltos pa dang / gdags pa'i ltos pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i ltos pa dang / gdags pa'i ltos pa'o //
translated: the dependence of origination and the dependence of designation.

original: de la skye ba'i ltos pa ni rgyu gang dag dang / rkyen gang dag gis phung po rnams skye bar 'gyur ba'i phung po'i skye ba de ni rgyu de dag dang / rkyen dang de dag las ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: de la skye ba'i ltos pa ni rgyu gang dag dang / rkyen gang dag gis phung po rnams skye bar 'gyur ba'i phung po'i skye ba de ni rgyu de dag dang / rkyen dang de dag las ltos pa yin no //
translated: The dependence of origination is that the origination of the aggregates depends on those causes and conditions by which the aggregates originate.

original: ming gi chogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs gang dag gi phung po rnams gdags par 'gyur ba'i phung po gdags pa de ni ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs de dag la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: ming gi chogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs gang dag gi phung po rnams gdags par 'gyur ba'i phung po gdags pa de ni ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs de dag la ltos pa yin te /
translated: The dependence of designation is that the designation of the aggregates depends on the collections of names, the collections of phrases, and the collections of letters by which the aggregates are designated.

original: de ni phung po rnams kyi skye ba'i ltos pa dang / gdags pa'i ltos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni phung po rnams kyi skye ba'i ltos pa dang / gdags pa'i ltos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the dependence of origination and the dependence of designation of the aggregates.

original: skye ba'i ltos pa gang yin pa dang / gdags pa'i ltos pa gang yin pa de ni phung po skye ba dang / phung por gdags pa'i rigs pa dang / sbyor ba dang thabs yin pas na de'i phyir ltos pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i ltos pa gang yin pa dang / gdags pa'i ltos pa gang yin pa de ni phung po skye ba dang / phung por gdags pa'i rigs pa dang / sbyor ba dang thabs yin pas na de'i phyir ltos pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The dependence of origination and the dependence of designation are the reasoning, application, and method for the origination of the aggregates and the designation of the aggregates. Therefore, it is called the reasoning of dependence.

original: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the principle of efficacy?

original: phung po rang gi rgyu dang / rang gi rkyen gyis bskyed pa gang yin pa rnams ni rang gi bya ba byed pa de dang de dag la sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: phung po rang gi rgyu dang / rang gi rkyen gyis bskyed pa gang yin pa rnams ni rang gi bya ba byed pa de dang de dag la sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Those aggregates that are generated by their own causes and their own conditions are applied to this or that function.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩdper na mig gis gzugs rnams la lta bar byed pa dang / rna bas sgra rnams nyan par byed pa dang / yid kyis chos rnams shes par byed pa'i bar lta bu dang / gzugs kyis mig gi spyod yul du gnas par byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na mig gis gzugs rnams la lta bar byed pa dang / rna bas sgra rnams nyan par byed pa dang / yid kyis chos rnams shes par byed pa'i bar lta bu dang / gzugs kyis mig gi spyod yul du gnas par byed pa dang /
translated: For example,üîΩthe eye sees forms, the ear hears sounds, and so on up to the mind being conscious of phenomena.

original: sgras rna ba'i spyod yul du gnas par byed pa dang / de bzhin du chos rnams kyis yid kyi spyod yul du gnas par byed pa'i bar @58a * //
analyzed: sgras rna ba'i spyod yul du gnas par byed pa dang / de bzhin du chos rnams kyis yid kyi spyod yul du gnas par byed pa'i bar @58a * //
translated: Form is the object of the eye, sound is the object of the ear, and so on up to phenomena being the object of the mind.

original: dag lta bu dang / gzhan yang de lta bu dang mthun pa'i chos rnams de dang de dag gcig la gcig bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / sbyor ba dang / thabs su 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dag lta bu dang / gzhan yang de lta bu dang mthun pa'i chos rnams de dang de dag gcig la gcig bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / sbyor ba dang / thabs su 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the principle of the performance of function refers to the fact that these dharmas are mutually related as the performance of function, application and means.

original: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the principle of logical possibility?

original: phung po rnams mi rtag pa'am /
analyzed: phung po rnams mi rtag pa'am /
translated: The aggregates are impermanent,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'am /
translated: dependently co-originated,

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: suffering,

original: stong pa'am / bdag med pa'o zhes tshad ma gsum po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: stong pa'am / bdag med pa'o zhes tshad ma gsum po 'di lta ste /
translated: empty and insubstantial.

original: yid ches pa'i lung dang / mngon sum du rjes su dpag pa dag gis nye bar rtog par byed cing 'thad pa'i rigs pa dam pa rnams kyi snying 'phrog par byed pa'i tshad ma gsum po de dag gis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung dang / mngon sum du rjes su dpag pa dag gis nye bar rtog par byed cing 'thad pa'i rigs pa dam pa rnams kyi snying 'phrog par byed pa'i tshad ma gsum po de dag gis 'di lta ste /
translated: The three kinds of valid cognition, namely, inference, direct perception and trustworthy scripture, investigate this and the three kinds of valid cognition, which captivate the hearts of the wise, are logically possible.

original: phung po rnams mi rtag pa nyid dam /
analyzed: phung po rnams mi rtag pa nyid dam /
translated: The aggregates are impermanent,

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid dam /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid dam /
translated: dependently co-originated,

original: sdug bsngal ba nyid dam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba nyid dam /
translated: suffering,üîΩempty and insubstantial.

original: stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dam /
translated: emptiness,üîΩüîΩ

original: bdag med pa nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed cing /üîΩsgrub par byed pa yin te ;
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed cing / sgrub par byed pa yin te ;
translated: It is the establishment and proof of emptiness and selflessness.

original: de'i 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called the reasoning of efficacy.

original: chos nyid kyi rigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reasoning of the nature of phenomena?

original: ci'i phyir phung po rnams de lta bur gyur ba yin /üîΩ'jig rten gnas pa de lta bur gyur pa yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po rnams de lta bur gyur ba yin / 'jig rten gnas pa de lta bur gyur pa yin /
translated: Why are the aggregates like that?üîΩWhy is the world like that?

original: ci'i phyir sa'i mtshan nyid sra ba yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa'i mtshan nyid sra ba yin /
translated: Why is the characteristic of earth solidity?

original: chu'i mtshan nyid gsher ba yin /
analyzed: chu'i mtshan nyid gsher ba yin /
translated: Why is the characteristic of water fluidity?

original: me'i mtshan nyid tsha ba yin ;
analyzed: me'i mtshan nyid tsha ba yin ;
translated: Why is the characteristic of fire heat?

original: rlung gi mtshan nyid g-yo ba yin /
analyzed: rlung gi mtshan nyid g-yo ba yin /
translated: Why is the characteristic of wind movement?

original: ci'i phyir phung po rnams mi rtag pa yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po rnams mi rtag pa yin /
translated: Why are the aggregates impermanent?

original: ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba yin /
translated: Why is nirvana peace?

original: de bzhin du ci'i phyir gzugs kyis mtshan nyid gzugs su rung ba yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du ci'i phyir gzugs kyis mtshan nyid gzugs su rung ba yin /
translated: Similarly, why is the characteristic of form suitability to materiality?

original: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid myong ba yin /
analyzed: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid myong ba yin /
translated: Why is the characteristic of feeling experience?

original: 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid kun shes par byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid kun shes par byed pa yin /
translated: Why is the characteristic of discernment making fully known?

original: 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid mngon par 'du byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid mngon par 'du byed pa yin /
translated: The characteristic of formations is to form.

original: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par shes par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par shes par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: The characteristic of consciousness is to be conscious.

original: de ni chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ni chos nyid yin te /
translated: This is the way things are.

original: chos de dag gi rang bzhin de yin zhing /
analyzed: chos de dag gi rang bzhin de yin zhing /
translated: This is the nature of these things.

original: de dag gi ngo bo nyid de lta bu yin pas chos nyid de gang kho na yin pa de nyid 'dir rigs pa dang / sbyor ba dang / thabs yin no //üîΩde bzhin du de lta bu'am /
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo nyid de lta bu yin pas chos nyid de gang kho na yin pa de nyid 'dir rigs pa dang / sbyor ba dang / thabs yin no // de bzhin du de lta bu'am /
translated: This is their essence. Therefore, this way things are is the logic, the application, and the method in this case.üîΩIn the same way, the way things are is the logic and the way things are alone is the method in all cases, whether it is like this,

original: gzhan nam / gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ni sems la gzhag par bya ba dang / sems la go bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad du yang chos nyid kho na la brten pa dang / chos nyid kho na'i rigs pa yin @58b te ;
analyzed: gzhan nam / gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ni sems la gzhag par bya ba dang / sems la go bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad du yang chos nyid kho na la brten pa dang / chos nyid kho na'i rigs pa yin @58b te ;
translated: or otherwise, or something else, in order to establish it in the mind and to make it understood in the mind.

original: de ni chos nyid kyi rigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni chos nyid kyi rigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the logic of the way things are.

original: de ltar na rigs pa bzhis phung po bstan pa dang / gzhan gang yang rung ba bstan pa la nges par rtogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rigs pa bzhis phung po bstan pa dang / gzhan gang yang rung ba bstan pa la nges par rtogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the four kinds of logic are the means of understanding the teaching of the aggregates and any other teaching.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis po bgrang ba dang / grangs kyi rnam pa dang / rigs pas nye bar rtog pa'i rnam pa de dag gis bstan pa de dang / de dag la yang dag par rtog par byed pa gang yin pa de ni sems pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis po bgrang ba dang / grangs kyi rnam pa dang / rigs pas nye bar rtog pa'i rnam pa de dag gis bstan pa de dang / de dag la yang dag par rtog par byed pa gang yin pa de ni sems pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the contemplation of the Dharma is the correct reflection on the teaching by means of two aspects, the aspect of enumeration and the aspect of reasoning.

original: de ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang sems pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang sems pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called listening to and contemplating the holy Dharma.

original: bar chad med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bar chad med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the uninterrupted?

original: bar chad ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bar chad ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of obstacles:

original: nang la brten pa dang / phyi rol la brten pa'o //
analyzed: nang la brten pa dang / phyi rol la brten pa'o //

analyzed: gti mug gi kun nas dkris pa de yang yun ring du sems kyi rgyud la gnas par byed cing /

translated: Here a person who is dominated by pride generates a thick and vast entanglement of pride even with regard to small things that are a basis for pride.

translated: It is to not have the disposition to speak politely, to bow, to rise up, to join one‚Äôs palms, or to bow down. It is to be self-centered and to praise oneself.

original: de la 'dod chags gang zhe na /üîΩ'dod chags ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags gang zhe na / 'dod chags ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: What is passion?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Passion is of five types:üîΩpassion for desire,üîΩpassion for sex,üîΩpassion for objects,üîΩpassion for form,

original: nang gi 'dod pa rnams kyis 'dod pa la 'dun pa 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / phyi rol gyi 'dod pa rnams kyis 'khrig pa la 'dun pa 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags dang / yul la 'dun pa yul gyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs la 'dun pa gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang /
analyzed: nang gi 'dod pa rnams kyis 'dod pa la 'dun pa 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / phyi rol gyi 'dod pa rnams kyis 'khrig pa la 'dun pa 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags dang / yul la 'dun pa yul gyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs la 'dun pa gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang /
translated: and passion for prestige.

original: 'jig tshogs la 'dun pa 'jig tshogs kyi 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la 'dun pa 'jig tshogs kyi 'dod chags so //
translated: The will to the body is the desire for the body.

original: 'dod chags rnam pa lnga po de dag spang ba dang / bsal ba dang / kun mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags rnam pa lnga po de dag spang ba dang / bsal ba dang / kun mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon, eliminate, and not produce these five types of desire,

original: mi sdug pa rnam pa drug pa dmigs te /
analyzed: mi sdug pa rnam pa drug pa dmigs te /
translated: one focuses on the six types of foulness.

original: de la nang la brten pa'i mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa nyid la dmigs pas ni /
analyzed: de la nang la brten pa'i mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa nyid la dmigs pas ni /
translated: Among them, by focusing on the foulness of the internal, impure body,

original: nang gi 'dod pa rnams kyi 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: nang gi 'dod pa rnams kyi 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
translated: one purifies the mind of desire for the internal, the desire for the body.

original: de la phyi rol la brten pa'i mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa nyid la dmigs pas ni /üîΩphyi rol gyi 'dod pa rnams kyis 'khrig pa la 'dun pa /
analyzed: de la phyi rol la brten pa'i mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa nyid la dmigs pas ni / phyi rol gyi 'dod pa rnams kyis 'khrig pa la 'dun pa /
translated: By focusing on the foulness of the external, impure body,

original: 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa /
translated: one purifies the mind of the four types of desire for sexual intercourse.

original: kha dog gi 'dod chags dang / dbyibs kyi 'dod chags dang / reg pa'i 'dod chags dang / nye bar spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
analyzed: kha dog gi 'dod chags dang / dbyibs kyi 'dod chags dang / reg pa'i 'dod chags dang / nye bar spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
translated: He purifies his mind of attachment to color, attachment to shape, attachment to contact, and attachment to service.

original: de la gang gi tshe rnam par bsngos pa dang / rnam par rnags pa dang / rnam par 'bus gzhigs pa dang / rnam par bam pa dang / rnam par zos pa yid la byed pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe rnam par bsngos pa dang / rnam par rnags pa dang / rnam par 'bus gzhigs pa dang / rnam par bam pa dang / rnam par zos pa yid la byed pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: When he attends to the bloated, the livid, the festering, the cut up, and the gnawed,

original: kha dog gi 'dod chags las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed do //üîΩdgang gi tshe rnam par dmar ba yid la byed pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: kha dog gi 'dod chags las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed do // dgang gi tshe rnam par dmar ba yid la byed pa de'i tshe na /
translated: he purifies his mind of attachment to color.üîΩWhen he attends to the scattered,

original: dbyibs kyi 'dod chags las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi 'dod chags las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
translated: he purifies his mind of attachment to shape.üîΩWhen he attends to the hacked and scattered,üîΩhe purifies his mind of attachment to contact.

original: gang gi tshe rus gong dang / keng rus dang / rus pa'i keng rus yid la byed pa de'i tshe na reg pa'i 'dod chags las sems rnam par sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rus gong dang / keng rus dang / rus pa'i keng rus yid la byed pa de'i tshe na reg pa'i 'dod chags las sems rnam par sbyor bar byed do //
translated: When he attends to the bones, the skeleton, and the skeleton without flesh but with veins,üîΩhe purifies his mind of attachment to service.

original: gang gi tshe rnam @80b par 'thor ba yid la byed pa de'i tshe ni /üîΩnye bar spyod pa'i 'dod chags las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam @80b par 'thor ba yid la byed pa de'i tshe ni / nye bar spyod pa'i 'dod chags las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
translated: When one attends to the scattered parts,üîΩone purifies the mind of attachment to enjoyment.

original: de ltar na 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: In this way, one purifies the mind of attachment to sexual intercourse.

original: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /üîΩphyi rol la brten pa'i mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang / phyi rol la brten pa'i mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Therefore, the Lord Buddha has said:

original: dur khrod pa rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: dur khrod pa rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe foulness of the external body is established as four types of charnel grounds.

original: des shi nas zhag gcig lon pa'am /
analyzed: des shi nas zhag gcig lon pa'am /
translated: One sees a charnel ground where a corpse has been discarded for one day,

original: shi nas zhag gnyis lon pa'am /
analyzed: shi nas zhag gnyis lon pa'am /
translated: or for two days,

original: shi nas zhag gsum lon pa'am /
analyzed: shi nas zhag gsum lon pa'am /
translated: or for three days,

original: shi nas zhag bdun lon pa'i bar gyi dur khrod gang dag bya rog dang / chun lag dang / bya rgod dang / khyi dang wa dag gis zos pa de mthong na /üîΩbdag gi lus 'di yang 'di lta bur 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: shi nas zhag bdun lon pa'i bar gyi dur khrod gang dag bya rog dang / chun lag dang / bya rgod dang / khyi dang wa dag gis zos pa de mthong na / bdag gi lus 'di yang 'di lta bur 'gyur zhing /
translated: or for seven days, and is being eaten by crows, vultures, dogs, and jackals.

original: 'di lta bur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta bur gyur pa ste /
translated: One thinks, ‚ÄòThis body of mine is like that and will become like that.üîΩIt is not exempt from that.‚Äô

original: chos nyid 'di las ma 'das pa yin no snyam du /
analyzed: chos nyid 'di las ma 'das pa yin no snyam du /
translated: One should think, This body is not beyond this nature.

original: de dag dang lus 'di nyid nye bar sbyor bar byed do zhes gsungs pa de ni /
analyzed: de dag dang lus 'di nyid nye bar sbyor bar byed do zhes gsungs pa de ni /
translated: One should apply this body to those.

original: rnam par bsngos pa dang / rnam par zos pa'i bar dag bstan to //üîΩdes pa gas pa dang / sha dang / khrag dang / chu rgyus kyi zungs dang bral ba'i dur khrod gang dag ma thong na zhes gang gsungs pa des ni rnam par dmar pa bstan to //üîΩdes dur khrod kyi rus ba gang dag mthong na zhes gang gsungs pa des ni rus gong dang / keng rus dang / rus pa'i keng rus bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par bsngos pa dang / rnam par zos pa'i bar dag bstan to // des pa gas pa dang / sha dang / khrag dang / chu rgyus kyi zungs dang bral ba'i dur khrod gang dag ma thong na zhes gang gsungs pa des ni rnam par dmar pa bstan to // des dur khrod kyi rus ba gang dag mthong na zhes gang gsungs pa des ni rus gong dang / keng rus dang / rus pa'i keng rus bstan to //
translated: This is the teaching on the stages from bloated up to eaten.üîΩThe line those skeletons that he sees in the charnel ground teaches bloody.üîΩThe line those skeletons that he sees in the charnel ground teaches bone, skeleton, and skeleton-ness.

original: des lag pa'i rus pa dag kyang logs shig / rkang pa'i rus pa dag kyang logs shig / long bu'i rus pa dag kyang logs shig bus mo'i rus pa dag kyang logs shig la /
analyzed: des lag pa'i rus pa dag kyang logs shig / rkang pa'i rus pa dag kyang logs shig / long bu'i rus pa dag kyang logs shig bus mo'i rus pa dag kyang logs shig la /
translated: He sees the hand bones here and there, the foot bones here and there, the ankle bones here and there, the knee bones here and there, the thigh bones here and there, the hip bones here and there, the spine bones here and there, the shoulder bones here and there, the neck bones here and there, and the skull bones here and there.

original: rtsib logs kyi rus pa dag dang / dbung ba'i rus pa dag dang / lag ngar gyi rus pa dag dang / sgal tshigs dang / 'gram sang dang / so rgyun dang / mgo thod dag kyang so sor 'thor ba'i dur khrod gang dag mthong zhing /
analyzed: rtsib logs kyi rus pa dag dang / dbung ba'i rus pa dag dang / lag ngar gyi rus pa dag dang / sgal tshigs dang / 'gram sang dang / so rgyun dang / mgo thod dag kyang so sor 'thor ba'i dur khrod gang dag mthong zhing /
translated: Or, if you see a charnel ground where the bones are white like conch shells,

original: de bzhin du lo gcig gam /
analyzed: de bzhin du lo gcig gam /
translated: having been there for one year,

original: lo gnyis sam /
analyzed: lo gnyis sam /
translated: two years,

original: lo gsum mam /
analyzed: lo gsum mam /
translated: three years,

original: lo bdun gyi bar tsam lon pa'i rus pa dung ltar dkar ba'am /
analyzed: lo bdun gyi bar tsam lon pa'i rus pa dung ltar dkar ba'am /
translated: up to seven years,üîΩor where the bones are the color of pigeons, mixed with the dust.

original: thi ba'i mdog 'dra bas rdul gyi phye ma dang 'dres pa dag mthong na zhes gang gsungs pa des ni rnam par 'thor ba bstan te /
analyzed: thi ba'i mdog 'dra bas rdul gyi phye ma dang 'dres pa dag mthong na zhes gang gsungs pa des ni rnam par 'thor ba bstan te /
translated: This shows the scattered state.

original: de ltar na phyi la brten pa'i mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa nyid la dmigs pas ni /üîΩ'khrig pa'i 'dod chags las sems rnam par @81a * //
analyzed: de ltar na phyi la brten pa'i mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa nyid la dmigs pas ni / 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags las sems rnam par @81a * //
translated: Thus, by observing the external impurity of the foul-smelling corpse,

original: sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: sbyong bar byed do //
translated: you should purify your mind of the attachment of sexual intercourse.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi mi sdug pa nyid la dmigs pa dang / ngan pa'i mi sdug pa nyid la dmigs pas ni yul la 'dun ba yul gyi 'dod chags las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi mi sdug pa nyid la dmigs pa dang / ngan pa'i mi sdug pa nyid la dmigs pas ni yul la 'dun ba yul gyi 'dod chags las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
translated: The meditation on the repulsiveness of suffering and the meditation on the repulsiveness of what is bad purify the mind of the desire for objects and of the passion for objects.

original: de la ltos pa'i mi sdug pa nyid la dmigs pas ni /
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i mi sdug pa nyid la dmigs pas ni /
translated: The meditation on the repulsiveness of dependence

original: gzugs la 'dun pa gzugs kyi 'dod chags las sems rnam par grol bar byed do //
analyzed: gzugs la 'dun pa gzugs kyi 'dod chags las sems rnam par grol bar byed do //
translated: purifies the mind of the desire for form and of the passion for form.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i mi sdug pa nyid la dmigs pa dang / rab tu 'jig pa'i mi sdug pa nyid la dmigs pas ni srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi 'jig tshogs la 'dun pa'i 'jig tshogs kyi 'dod chags las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i mi sdug pa nyid la dmigs pa dang / rab tu 'jig pa'i mi sdug pa nyid la dmigs pas ni srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi 'jig tshogs la 'dun pa'i 'jig tshogs kyi 'dod chags las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
translated: The meditation on the repulsiveness of defilement and the meditation on the repulsiveness of complete destruction purify the mind of the desire for the perishing of the perishable and of the passion for the perishing of the perishable.

original: de ni re zhig 'dod chags spyad pa'i spyad pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig 'dod chags spyad pa'i spyad pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: This is the object of meditation for the purification of the practice of one who is given to passion.

original: dmigs pa ma sdug pa srid do cog gi thams cad rnam pa thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir de skad brjod par zad kyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa ma sdug pa srid do cog gi thams cad rnam pa thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir de skad brjod par zad kyi /
translated: It is called this because it includes all the aspects of all the objects of meditation for purifying behavior.

original: don gyi skabs 'dir ni mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa de nyid las dgongs pa yin te /üîΩde las gzhan pa'i mi sdug pa rnams ni /
analyzed: don gyi skabs 'dir ni mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa de nyid las dgongs pa yin te / de las gzhan pa'i mi sdug pa rnams ni /
translated: But in this context, the meaning is that of the impurity of the unattractive.

original: de las gzhan pa'i spyad pa dag rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa yang yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i spyad pa dag rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa yang yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The other types of unattractive objects are objects of meditation for purifying behavior other than the one just described.

original: de la byams pa gang zhe na /üîΩmdza' bshes kyi phyogs dang / dgra bo'i phyogs dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i phan pa'i bsam pa nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la byams pa gang zhe na / mdza' bshes kyi phyogs dang / dgra bo'i phyogs dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i phan pa'i bsam pa nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: What is loving-kindness?

original: bde ba chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir mos pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir mos pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the will to place those who are dear, those who are neutral, and those who are hateful in the state of happiness, and it is the will to establish them in the highest form of happiness, in the happiness of the stage of composure, in the happiness of the stage of advanced understanding, and in the ultimate happiness of nirvana.

original: de la mdza' bshes kyi phyogs dang / dgra bo'i phyogs dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mdza' bshes kyi phyogs dang / dgra bo'i phyogs dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The objects of meditation for this are those who are dear, those who are neutral, and those who are hateful.

original: de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i phan pa'i bsam pa dang / bde ba nye bar bsgrub ba'i phyir mos pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i phan pa'i bsam pa dang / bde ba nye bar bsgrub ba'i phyir mos pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the intention to establish in the stage of meditative concentration, and the aspiration to bring about their benefit and happiness.

original: dmigs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs par byed pa yin te /
translated: It is the one who has the intention.

original: de ltar na dmigs pa gang yin pa de dang / dmigs par byed pa gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni byams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dmigs pa gang yin pa de dang / dmigs par byed pa gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni byams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the one who has the meditative object and the one who has the intention are combined into one, and are called ‚Äúloving-kindness.‚Äù

original: de la byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes gang gsungs pa de ni /
analyzed: de la byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes gang gsungs pa de ni /
translated: In this regard, the statement ‚Äúthe mind endowed with loving-kindness‚Äù

original: re zhig phyogs gsum po mdza' bo'i phyogs dang / dgra bo'i phyogs dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs dag la phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa bstan to //üîΩkho na med pa /
analyzed: re zhig phyogs gsum po mdza' bo'i phyogs dang / dgra bo'i phyogs dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs dag la phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa bstan to // kho na med pa /
translated: indicates the superior intention of benefit with regard to the three spheres: the sphere of friends, the sphere of enemies, and the sphere of those who are indifferent.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúwithout hostility, without hatred‚ÄùüîΩindicates the superior intention of benefit with regard to the sphere of enemies.

original: 'gran zla med pa /
analyzed: 'gran zla med pa /
translated: The statement ‚Äúwithout rivalry, without jealousy‚ÄùüîΩindicates the superior intention of benefit with regard to the sphere of friends.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúwithout spite, without harm‚Äù

original: gnod pa med pa zhes gang gsungs pa des na phan @81b pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa de nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum bstan te /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa zhes gang gsungs pa des na phan @81b pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa de nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum bstan te /
translated: indicates the superior intention of benefit with regard to the sphere of those who are indifferent.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúwithout contention, without strife‚Äù

original: de la kho na med pas ni phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yin te /
analyzed: de la kho na med pas ni phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yin te /
translated: indicates the superior intention of benefit with regard to the sphere of those who are indifferent.

original: de yang tshig 'og ma gnyis po 'gran zla med pa dang / gnod pa med pa la zhes bya ba dag gis rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: de yang tshig 'og ma gnyis po 'gran zla med pa dang / gnod pa med pa la zhes bya ba dag gis rnam par bshad do //
translated: Moreover, it is explained by the next two phrases, ‚Äúunrivaled‚Äù and ‚Äúunimpaired.‚Äù

original: de la phas kyi dga'i dngos por gnas pa med pa'i don gyis ni 'gran zla med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la phas kyi dga'i dngos por gnas pa med pa'i don gyis ni 'gran zla med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Among them, it is ‚Äúunrivaled‚Äù in the sense that it is not situated as an object of dispute.

original: gnod pa byed pa rnam par spyod pa med pa'i don gyis ni gnod pa med pa nyid yin no //üîΩyangs pa dang rgya chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa zhes gang gsungs pa des ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa'i sa ba dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa chung ngu dang /
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa rnam par spyod pa med pa'i don gyis ni gnod pa med pa nyid yin no // yangs pa dang rgya chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa zhes gang gsungs pa des ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa'i sa ba dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa chung ngu dang /
translated: It is ‚Äúunimpaired‚Äù in the sense that it is not situated as an object of harm.

original: 'bring dang / chen po bstan to //
analyzed: 'bring dang / chen po bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúvast, extensive, immeasurable‚Äù indicates the accomplishment of lesser, middling, and greater happiness on the levels of the desire realm, the first and second meditative absorptions, and the third meditative absorption.

original: mos te khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gang gsungs pa de sa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir mos pa bstan te /
analyzed: mos te khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gang gsungs pa de sa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir mos pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe accomplishes and dwells in it, having pervaded and focused on it‚Äù indicates the focus on the accomplishment of the happiness of the level of meditative equipoise.

original: bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa de yang phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas yongs su zin pa dang / mos pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i mdza' bshes kyi phyogs dang / dgra bo'i phyogs dang /
analyzed: bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa de yang phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas yongs su zin pa dang / mos pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i mdza' bshes kyi phyogs dang / dgra bo'i phyogs dang /
translated: Moreover, that attainment of happiness is embraced by the superior intention of benefit, it is associated with keeping interest in mind, and it is applied to those who are neither suffering nor happy, to those who are friends and to those who are enemies.

original: tha mal pa'i phyogs la bde bar 'dod pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩsdug bsngal ba dang / bde bar gyur pa'i mdza' bshes kyi phyogs dang / dgra bo'i phyogs dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de dag las sdug bsngal bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /üîΩsnying rje'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i phyogs la bde bar 'dod pa yin par rig par bya'o // sdug bsngal ba dang / bde bar gyur pa'i mdza' bshes kyi phyogs dang / dgra bo'i phyogs dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de dag las sdug bsngal bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni / snying rje'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: This attainment of happiness is also to be known as the wish for happiness in regard to the group of friends who are suffering, the group of enemies, and the group of strangers, through the possession of the superior intention of benefit, through the mental attention of faith, and through the absence of suffering and the absence of happiness.üîΩThe group of friends who are suffering, the group of enemies, and the group of strangers, when they are suffering, are the objects of compassion.

original: bde bar gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dga' ba'i dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: bde bar gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dga' ba'i dmigs pa yin te /
